      • getString

        public String getString(String propertyName)
                 throws GramarException
        Returns the value of the given property name as specified in either the command line arguments or the specified property file. If the property is not present then throw an exception. Note this class's static constants for common property names for convenience.
        Parameters:
        propertyName -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        GramarException

      • hasValue

        public boolean hasValue(String propertyName)
        Answers whether the given property name was provided in the command line arguments or in the property file Note this class's static constants for common property names for convenience.
        Parameters:
        propertyName -
        Returns:
        true/false depending on whether a value exists for the given property name
        Throws:
        GramarException

      • getString

        public String getString(String propertyName,
               String defaultValue)
        Returns the value of the given property name as specified in either the command line arguments or the specified property file. If the property is not present then return the given defaultValue. Note this class's static constants for common property names for convenience.
        Parameters:
        propertyName -
        Returns:

      • getIndexedValues

        public static List<String> getIndexedValues(Properties properties,
                            String propertyNamePrefix)
        Returns all values whose corresponding property name starts with the given prefix. For example, a propertyNamePrefix of "a.b." would return values for properties "a.b.1", "a.b.2" and "a.b.c".
        Parameters:
        properties -
        propertyNamePrefix -
        Returns:

               String value,
               boolean override)
        Set the value of a property. If the property is already set and override is false, do not override the existing value.
        Parameters:

        value -
